View the story here:
 http://www2.ljworld.com/news/2006/dec/12/kline_chosen_johnson_county_district_attorney/
 
 Another link is here but I think it will tell you you need a subscription. If it does, just go to their homepage and do a search for Phil Kline and you will get to the story without havinf to do the subscription:
 http://www.kansascity.com/mld/kansascity/news/16218307.htm
 
 
 Here is the gist of the story: Phil Kline, who despite having served four years as an attorney general had absolutely no experience prosecuting criminal cases, but still had support of anti-choicers. He ran against Democrat Paul Morrison in November for the position of Attorney General. Kline lost with 41 percent to Morrison's 59 percent. 
 
 
 Now, members of the Republican precinct commitee (not a public voting group but that of the Republican party) where Paul Morrison left his county district attorney position to become the new attorney general, voted for the appointment for the new position. They voted in Phil Kline. This is the same man that the voters voted overwhelmingly aginst in the election. In fact, in Johnson county where he will take this new position, he lost 35 percent to Morrison's 65 percent in that district. This is a prime example of how the Republicans care only for themselves, and not for the voice of the people.
 
 By the way, his nomination was mainly supported by an anti-choice group called Kansans-for-Life.
 
 
 This is just one of the examples for the reason I will never vote for a Republican candidate again. (I used to vote Republican until George W.)
 Other examples are of course their blatant anti-abortion and anti-gay actions.

Why did the Republican party choose him? What happened to the Morrison guy who beat him?
 
 BTW, if you are going to use the term "anti-choicers" be prepared to be called "Pro-death".

Why did the Republican party choose him? What happened to the Morrison guy who beat him?
 
 BTW, if you are going to use the term "anti-choicers" be prepared to be called "Pro-death".

 
 If you had read the article, you would have seen that Morrison won the state Attorney General position. As a result, his previous position of district attorney of Johnson county was open. The republican group chose to defy the wishes of the people by allowing Kline to get the vacated position, despite the fact that Johnson County voters had voted overwhelmingly against him in the Attorney General election. If you had actually read it, maybe you wouldn't need to ask the obvious.
 
 I can use the term "anti-choice", whenever I please. I don't care at all if you call me "pro-death", because I know it is a lie. Your ilk however, can accurately be called anti-choice, as your movement tries to deny women the choice of having an abortion, and in some cases, even tries to deny us contraceptive methods.

Is that blatent rudeness nesscary? Sorry, I have better things to do than scour this article. So I just skimmed it. And in the process of skimming, I thought it was morrison who beat kline in the DA election, and that the Rep.'s put kline into the DA spot.

Is that blatent rudeness nesscary? Sorry, I have better things to do than scour this article. So I just skimmed it. And in the process of skimming, I thought it was morrison who beat kline in the DA election, and that the Rep.'s put kline into the DA spot.

 
 The way I see it, you should avoid posting on a thread until you have read everything in it. It saves everyone involved time and annoyance if you don't ask questions that can easily be answered if you read what is provided. Anyone who doesn't I see as rather inconsiderate and not worth my time.
^Your opinion. If I'm not worth your time, ignore me.

I know Phill Kline personally and the man is a jackass and an idiot. I can't believe that the Johnson County republicans are that stupid. I guess they want to ensure that they LOOSE that seat in the next full election. 
 
 WTF were you XXXXXX in johnson county thinking???

 WTF were you XXXXXX in johnson county thinking???

 
 I know, I live across the river in Parkville, and everyone I have talked to both here and in Johnson County where I work, are outraged. There has been quite an uproar around here. Much of the comments section of the Kansas City Star has been filled the past week with citizens expressing their disbelief and outrage. Many of them are actually Republicans who say that this has lost the party their vote next election, at least in state and local elections.
